DOC.brief_summary: Conflicting results have been reported concerning the association of pseudoexfoliation syndrome (PXF) and abdominal aortic aneurysms (AAA). Schumacher et al. reported an association between AAA and PXF, with no consideration of grade. However, a later study did not confirm the association between AAA and PXF. The present study aimed at comparing the relative prevalence of PXF in patients suffering from AAA and in age-matched hypertensive patients.
DOC.brief_title: Abdominal Aortic Aneurysms and Pseudoexfoliation Syndrome
DOC.criteria: Presence of abdominal aortic aneurism Systemic hypertension without abdominal aortic aneurism over 60 years old Unknown status for abdominal aortic aneurism
